string.text: Do you deal in vehicles?
Sure thing. Here's what I have available at the moment:
at the Rookie Camp by the Cordon
in a field near the Dump
at the Scientific Institute in Agroprom
Okay, it's yours. I'll arrange to have it left near the Rookie Camp for you
Look for it near the Dump, in a field. I'll make sure the Bandits don't mess with it either. They owe me some favors
The car is somewhere in the central complex, but be very cautious. When I spoke with the Colonel he was quite drunk, and may have forgotten to inform his men that you'll be collecting it
Understood. Thanks
Screw that! Your prices are outrageous!
You don't have that kind of money, so piss off...
I need a vehicle of some sort. Do you have anything?
I can provide you with a vehicle, but they don't come cheap, understood?\n Here's what I have working at the moment:
A Kama3 truck in the Dark Valley
A military field car at the Army Warehouses

A truck like this is hard to come by. I can arrange for it to be left at the abandoned gas station, across from the Bandit Base in the Dartk Valley. Get there quickly, before someone comes along and steals it, or simply strips it down for spare parts!

The Freedom faction has somehow managed to get their hands on a working military field Car. They have no use for it themselves, so they've asked me to sell it for them. You can pick it up at their base of operations inside the Army Warehouses. Good luck...
Are there any cars available nearby?
Now that's information you need to pay for. There may be one prospective option nearby. What do you say?
A YA-3 in the Red Forest
When you exit the bunker, it'll be on your right. You'll want to be careful though - such a vehicle is a rare and expensive commodity so far north in the Zone...
Unfortunately, you don't have enough cash. Sorry...
BTR-80 Armored Personnel Carrier
Farm tractor
Niva field car
UAZ van
Zaporozhets economy car
ZAZ-965 Hunchback
Kama3 truck
Do you know where there's a car I can use? I'm not keen on walking through the swamps...

A car here is a luxury most people can't afford. Just be cautious when navigating through anomolies. And mutants, who don't give a shit whether you're in a vehicle or not. For transportation, I can offer you the following:
'Dodge Charger' in the Swamps
'Hummer' located in the Cordon
Okay, listen up. As you pass by the nearest farm where the Stalkers have set up camp, you'll see a ruined building. Behind it, you'll find the car of your dreams! I've marked the location on your map

The Hummer is a very sought after vehicle, both beyond the perimeter and within the Zone itself. So please look after it. Avoid anomalies, and it should last you a while longer.\nI've marked its location on your map
Sorry, brother. Not enough money...
Dodge Charger
Hummer
Hey, I've heard you sell eBooks that can be uploaded to my PDA

Yes, but it won't cost you anything! Very few people read books these days, even through they're a gold mine of information, but everyone's so obsessed with artefacts and staying alive. If you're interested, though, I can point you to a secure website outside the Zone: www.tecnobacon.com\syslov_books.html. You can trust this guy. He and his team fight for Stalkers everywhere...
Thank you very much. I appreciate it!
I need information on all the different territories within the Zone

You're asking a lot! I'll give you the information, but you'll need to pay for it, since it was hard-earned. There are some secret locations I don't have much data on, so you'll have to figure them out on your own.\nWell, I've information on the Dead City, Limansk, and the Generators. Anything else you need?
Yes. What else, please?
No thanks. I need to get going
There's information on laboratories X-10, X-16, X-18, a certain confidential laboratory, and a secret Military lab. All this will cost, let's say, 1500Ru. Are you interested?
That's a lot more reasonable than I'd have expected. Here's the money, and my PDA details
That's a bit expensive for me. I'll find out what I need by myself
What the hell is this storm all about?
I don't have any information on it, but it's sure got me worried!
Why are you worried?
I'm afraid there'll be another influx of Military soon, to try and control us!
Well, there's no way they'll be controlling me!
Do you sell any specialized items?
I sell special weapons, if that's what you mean. Plus ammunition that no one else can supply. Interested?
Upgrade block #3 for SKAT15-M
Not at the moment, thanks. Maybe later.

I have an upgrade module for a SKAT15 suit. This kind of tech normally needs Black Energy artefacts to run it, but this will fix it so that it doesn't\nInterestingly, it was left here by a guy who said he wanted it kept in safe hands for the right buyer, so I helped him out...\nAnyway, it's a one-off, hence the price tag of 45,000Ru plus a Soul Drops artefact. Are you interested?
Sounds good to me. You've got a deal!
45,000 is a hell of a lot for an encapsulated module that you can't get into, and Black Energy's not that difficult to find when you know what you're doing. Thanks, but not interested...
I've heard rumors that you may have information regarding something known as the 'Soul Cube'. Is this true?

Ah, this is a very rare and precious thing, and nobody knows where it came from. Whatever it's actually designed for, it will... how can I put it?... draw and disengage the vital life energy from any creature. In other words, it will kill anything or anyone, quickly, regardless of size or protection. They'll die from absence of life. From death itself. Is this what you're looking for?
Yes, it is. How much?

I don't want any money for it. It's not the kind thing you sell, or pay for with money. If you'd like it, there are some things you can do to help me, in order for it to change hands...
Firstly, our small group is very low on ammunition
We also need a more powerful weapon, like the one the trader near Agroprom sells
We desperately need to improve our Scientific outfits, too. As far as I know, the Mercs have some suits equipped with advanced filtering, heavy-duty glass, and durable protective plates. If you bring us one of these, Basil can take it apart and incorporate its technologies into our own suits
We're also short of food for our Scouts. Find us five bottles of vodka - Nemiroff, please! Two of those green IRP-B Military dry-ration packs, three Yantar cheeses, five cans of nuts, three cans of Chernigov beer, and five cans of Adrenalin Rush.
Help us out with this, and I will happily bequeath ownership of the Soul Cube to you. Does this sound fair, Stalker?
I'd be happy to accept your offer, and help you out as well. Everybody gains...
Sorry. You want me to buy all these things for you at my own expense, and I've no way of knowing if you're telling the truth about what this Soul Cube does...
Here's everything you asked me for
Thank you, friend. This will certainly help us out in defending this place from attackers!
Thank you. Do you have the Cube?
Well, I don't actually have it here...\nPlease, let me explain...
You said we had a deal. A deal in good faith...\nWhat's going on here?
Well, I said that I would transfer ownership to you...\nBut you'll need to collect it...
You've left it a little late to tell me this, and you could have collected it yourself. What's the problem?

Look, I sent my men to check the hiding place where the Cube is hidden. When they got there, there was this Stalker there, a real weird bastard, and well-armed too! My guys were a bit confused at first, but one kept him talking while the other went to check the hiding spot, and it was empty! So they both confronted the son of a bitch, and of course he denied all knowledge of it. My men weren't well equipped enough to take him on, so they came back. I'll tell you exactly where he is, and I'm sure he'll tell you, or maybe you can convince him to part with it on mutual terms, if you know what I mean! This isn't the way I normally do business, and it's my reputation on the line so, if you succeed, I'll give you 25,000Ru to square us up. Okay?
Okay, tell me where I can find this Stalker...\nAnything else I need to know about him?
Fuck off! Pay me now for everything I bought, plus the 25,000 for my work. Then we'll forget it...
Near the old tower to the west of our base, the one with the light still on...\nPersonally, I wouldn't go near there myself. Not with this asshole wandering about the place. So good luck...
Okay, I'll check it out. But if it turns out to be a dead end, you're going to have more than that guy to worry about...
Another one... So what do YOU want?
You must be Shadows! It's an honour to meet you and, I must say, your suit is amazing... I've come about the Soul Cube. I understand you've been looking after it for me. I'm its rightful owner...
Yes, I have. I've been protecting it from the wrong kind of people - those who'd misuse it. But I'm not sure that you're the right kind...
The Cube now belongs to me. I've earned it, and I'd like it, please...
Do you know what you're dealing with here? Do you even know what to do with this Cube?
I earned the Cube honestly and honorably, helping out Syslov and his party. Do you still doubt me?
I'll figure it out. It's mine, so hand it over...
You won't be able to use the Cube...
Why not?
Here, check it out yourself. Catch...
We're finished, Stalker. I have nothing more to say to you...
Give me the fucking Cube!
Go away, Stalker. Our conversation is over...
So what does this mean? I don't understand...
It means that this Cube is a fake. Very well made, but still a fake...
Is there an original?
Most likely. Yes. I can even tell you where it was produced...
Thank you. This conversation is going in the right direction. I'm listening...

The project was very costly. I knew a guy from the Cube team, Pavel. At the time I'd report to the authorities at Chernobyl Main Control. You probably heard that a second large sarcophagus would be built over the fourth reactor? Well, I was one of those who sent down into the reactor to assess and measure the radiation damage from the first explosion. This costume I'm wearing - the latest development from the American scientists - was supposed to withstand 'unprecedented and destructive' doses of radiation but, as usual, things didn't go according to plan. During the descent from the roof of the reactor, the main cable snapped and I fell the last six metres to the bottom of the sarcophagus. I landed badly, on top of all the old fuel rods. I could barely stand up but, with no cable, I knew that nobody was coming to get me out. They kept talking to me on my comms, said they were going outside the perimeter to get a new cable, but it was obvious I couldn't stay here, at the base of the reactor, even in this 'super' suit...
Go on...

I began to look for another way. Getting up a bit, I noticed a doorway piled up with sand. It was unlocked, and I forced it open.
I ended up wandering the corridors of the underground, before finding a manhole to climb out through in Pripyat. I felt so dizzy I was staggering every few steps, so I knew I had first degree radiation sickness... Fortunately it was raining, so I lay down in the street and let it decontaminate me. I spent the rest of the night in the doorway of someone's home... The next day I picked up a military detachment, which was accompanied by a few scientists. One of them I talked to was interested in my suit. As a result, they took me to the home of my new friend. His name was Pavel. He lived in one of the skyscrapers of Pripyat, on the top floor. I remember there was a cinema next to it... His apartment was actually in very good condition, considering that the whole town had been looted, then occupied by the Monolith. Oh, and mutants too... Most likely it was one of the few the only habitable apartments left after the second explosion...
After examining me and my suit, I was offered a job in the laboratory in the same city, but I refused - my work with the old one hadn't worked out so well. Soon after that I left Pavel's hospitality, because he barely had enough non-radiated food for himself
Shortly afterwards, I heard reports that his lab had been attacked by an unknown creature, with nearly everyone dead... An organized military unit went there, to track down the surviving scientists in Pripyat. Amongst them was Pavel but, soon after, he disappeared again, this time without a trace... I wanted to go looking for him myself, but I didn't know which area. I guess he's still stuck there somewhere...
Wow, that's a hell of a story... So how can we help each other?

While I was in Pavel's apartment for a few days, I noticed documents that described the Cube. Even the pictures were, well... most likely they're still in his lab where it was created. Although after the second explosion, they were probably all destroyed... But I wonder there's any information still in his apartment? You need to go to Pripyat, don't you?\n I can't go back there. Not now. But if you were to, it would help put my mind at rest...
Where's the apartment located?
In the eastern part of Pripyat, next to the cinema. The top floor. That large vine outside the window may still be there
Okay, I'll go...\nAnd see what I can find for you...
Excellent. I'll keep you informed through PDA messages. Just remember that others can read them too, and may also be interested in what you find...
Okay, then be as discrete as you can with your messages...
Hi, I've been there...
You did? What did you find? Anything about Pavel?

I found his laboratory - a horrific place. There are still ghosts there. Mutants, too...\nI found the Cube - a thing of terrible beauty. It works just as Pavel wrote. He was still holding on to it. I think it would have fallen through the Zone if not for him...
Was he still... alive?

I'm afraid he'd been dead a long time. When I got inside the place where his body was, there was a horrible scream... From the records, I'd say it was the same ghost that destroyed the whole laboratory...\nBut Pavel chose his fate. I'm sorry, but he was literally playing with death, and no one forced him to work alone in that lab...

Shit! Shit! Damn! I just knew it'd come to this. He kept going back' ... Okay, did you bring any of those records with you? Documents, plans, any other information from the lab? And would you be happy to part with Pavel's diary? Naturally, I'd pay you for finding it...
Yes, of course. Please take it
No, I'd prefer to hang on to it for now
Okay. Maybe you have something else you found?
Thank you for the diary. It means a lot to me. Do you have any other information you don't need?
A plan of the Army Warehouses, with unknown markings
A map of East Pripyat, with Lab X-8 marked
Other documents from Lab X-8
No, nothing else
Thank you. Anything else?
Yes, here
Well
Okay, thank you. At least I learned of Pavel. Now I must leave here for the perimeter, finally...
May your roads be good. Farewell, my friend
Wow, still kickin', eh!
Hi there... are there many of you here?
Just a few... When the Scorcher was switched off, we all rushed to the center. Now we've got a small base organized here...
I see... Well, who's in charge?
That'll be Formidable - he's on the second floor
Formidable? I see... Well, can I go inside?
Of course. Come in. There're never enough guns in this place!
I talked with Formidable. He doesn't look so formidable to me, but he was very helpful...
Yes, but he's a solid man-wall. That's how he got his name...
Interesting. Thank you...
Where did you come from, Stalker? What brings you here?
I'm looking for life among the ruins... I spotted your base and decided to check it out. How long have you been here?

Just a short while... After the Scorcher shut down, we planned to go to Chernobyl. We heard there are Klondike artefacts there... But there was so much shit happening there, we set up camp here in the meantime...
Is this all there is of you?

When we broke into Pripyat, we were attacked by a group of Monolith... They pinned us down by the bus station. I suggested Hawaiian go east to the hotel, but he kept insisting that we had to break through the stadium to Chernobyl... So we parted ways. That left Sanya, Sledgehammer, Sage, and myself...
So what happened next?

Well, when we approached the hotel we spotted some freak on a hill with a Gauss rifle. That fucking thing'll give you the mother of all headaches... We couldn't touch him, and he took out three of our guys! Fucking fanatic...\nWe couldn't go any further, so we decided to pull back and regroup... Crossed the road in front of a sniper, turned into a neighborhood to the east, and came to the CCD... But we saw silhouettes in the building, probably more Monolith. So we carried on until we got to the laundry...\nOh, and not far from here, in one of the courtyards, you'll find the Kamaz military on the move!
Woo, glad I came across you first instead of them...
So, what exactly are you are looking for?
Any underground facilities, laboratories, anything like that. Do you know of any, and ways to get in?

Sorry, I've not heard anything. But when we searched the hospital area, north of the laundry, in one of the rooms are some torn maps of Pripyat. I think there was an underground facility marked on one of them. Sorry, but we were looking for medkits, not old papers. Maybe they'll be of more use to you...
Thanks! I'll go take a look at this place...
Hello. Are you Sage?
Yes, my friend. A simple Stalker...
I heard you were looking for something...
What, no pleasantries? No news? I'm afraid we have very little but time here...
Sorry. My friend Sledgehammer just died...

string_table.string: Ah. I am really sorry to hear that. Shall we drink to him?SA
What a pity. He was my friend, too. Too many good people die here. For no good reason...SA
I know there's nothing more we can do, though...MO
So, what is it you wanted? Why are you here?SA
Actually, I was looking for someone. A scientist named Pavel. Have you heard of him?MO

string.text: Pavel, eh? Only rumors... I'm sick of rumors, with no coherent facts...
So what do you do?

Me? I repair stuff. I can make anything out of nothing, but there are limits. There's no spare parts here, and very few decent tools. It's like trying to cook without a stove. Nor ingredients. I'm thinking of checking out the neighborhood. See if I can find anything useful or adaptable...
When are you planning to go?
Why do you ask? In a few days, maybe. I need to prepare. You never know what you'll find out there. Or what'll find you...
Can I help you search for tools?
Well, that would be very helpful, and I could help you out in return. Since you've made it here, you already know the area better than I do anyway...
Okay
Actually, I changed my mind...
Right. I'll start looking...
I'll see if I can find any tools for you
What? Have you changed your mind again?
Yes, you could say that...
Here are some tools I found...

Wow! These are superb! You've done really well. Right, let's have a look at your kit so I can try out my new toys. This should be fun...\nLook, a good job takes time to do properly, so feel free to avail yourself of our facilities for a few days
Okay, but I'd appreciate it if you could speed it up a little...
May I do an exchange with you?
Certainly! I exchange certain consumables for others. With a small commission, of course...
I'm looking for Death's Head cigarettes
I can give you a pack, in exchange for two packs of Dream cigarettes, or three Cigars
Here are the cigarettes
Here are the cigars
I need some Cossacks vodka
Either two bottles of Absolut, or one bottle of Smirnov plus 100Ru
Here's two bottles of Absolut
Here, take the Smirnov, and the money
I'd like a Doctor's Sausage, please
Either two sticks of Doctor's Sausage, or one bottle of Chernigov beer
Here, take the sausage sticks
Here, take the beer
Sorry, no deal...
Hello, Stalker. How can I help you?
Hello. I heard that you were the Bartender in these parts. Buy me a drink?

Yes, I would be the Bartender. I see that you are not just wandering for the sake of it. We don't see many Loners here in the Swamplands. We're more used to Bandits, and travelling Avengers looking to trade.\nA drink?, sure thing, have some Vodka, it's on the house! Sit, let's have a chat.
Nemiroff Vodka.
Absolut Vodka.
Smirnov Vodka.

It used to be much quieter here. Trails were safe, and people could come, and go as they pleased. Not the type of place you would bring a date too, the Swamps, but life was good. But, just like everywhere else in the Zone, the Emissions, the crime, the anomalies, it all changed. Folks leave to find their fortune out in the Zone, only to come back, broken. But, we've managed to survive here, and it will get better, somehow.
And you then, yourself, what's your story?

There was no place for me in that world. So, I made a life for myself here. It was hard going, but I managed. The Clear Sky Faction needed a Trader, and I fit that role. It has been good, so far. As long as I can provide them with the goods they need, they will keep me fed, and maybe someday I will settle here for good. That would be nice. By the way, they call me Cold.
Yeah, you guys seem to have a good thing going here, what could go wrong?!

We are protected from any unwanted visitors by a Teleport. They cannot enter it. But, as you can see, our Base is a modest, romantic farm in the middle of these vast wetlands. We are the last, all the rest have been overrun by Outsiders, like yourself. This is somewhere you can meet real people. Those who don't shoot you on sight, and who would share what they have with you, understand?!
Thank you for the information. I'll have a good look around.
Wow, I got the Beryl...
Excellent. Now, most likely warriors believe that you are the one colonel. Karoche, the military is waiting for you Uazik near the farm, south of the broken bridge' ... Go.
Clear.
Oh, another new face...
Hello. Do you own one?
And you care about it a lot?
Yes, in fact not very' ... Just wondering.
If interested, I would say. I - conductor. I drive people to their places of interest. Can you and somewhere to reduce' ... Not for free of course...
Yes, I'll still do not know' ... How can I be sure that you do not shoot me in the back as soon as possible and not zaberesh swag?

My dear, I have many who know his reputation, I cherish. I taught myself Explorer ferret out safe paths and trust "sixth sense". Throughout my practice, there was no overlap. All clients are alive and well, at least after my delivery of them in place. Heh-heh. Karoche you something concrete to?
While there is no vprintsepi. But if you need you, will turn.

Immediately tell - I drive to where my client was at least once. Or if he has some important job in the locality. Perhaps you will say - but then why all the conductors, if you can get yourself? And then, what do they know much shorter and safer paths. And walk with a guide can garazdo faster than its own. In any case, it's you.
I realized.
Syslov, I've heard there's an underground tote in the Zone... I need to raise some money, but there's no rush, if you know what I mean...

Well there is such a thing, just consider: here or Pan - won or lost - as you can put a 50 and win only 500 Roubles. And then either pay - Round and round as you like, but can not - in debt bondage' ... Either one would find in a swamp of someone's body' ... So that's that.
Yes, harsh' ... However, the need. As a bookmaker to find something?
Why look for it - I, Spot, I...
So that's it as' ... Okay, what are the conditions?

Your bid climbs and will not be refunded. Whether you win or lose I'll tell you. You can play while in debt, but the debt will accrue compounded interest every 12 hours. So the choice is yours: to play or not play. Also, if you win you can leave the money with me for safekeeping. I offer a good percentage in interest
Okay, I agree. What odds?
Odds, like the wind on the Pripyat River, are constantly changing. Even I don't know what they'll be today. Now that's a bet...
Bid: 100Ru
Bid: 500Ru
Bid: 1,000Ru
Bid: 1,500Ru
Bid: 2,000Ru
Bid: 2,500Ru
Bid: 3,000Ru
Bid: 3,500Ru
Bid: 4,000Ru
Bid refused
Everything okay - your bid is accepted. Now please wait for the message. Good luck, dude!
Okay, I'll go...
You Labelled with oak fell chtoli? You've got more than a hundred pieces, and you are prohibited from making bids. Come on tomatoes moving away.
The evil you...
Syslov's great - I for donations and.
Right now let's see what's owed to you.
Come on - do not pull the rubber. Get the loot.
Weather' ... Right now' ... Open safe.
Withdraw money.
Leave on for storage.
Syslov - this is payback came to give.
Okay - debt for you no more. Single.
Withdraw your deposit
Choose how much you want to withdraw
Withdraw 10% of the total
Withdraw half of the total
Withdraw the entire amount
Well, hold.
Thank you for that well-kept Syslov. I will go relax Maleh.
Yes, Spot is not your day today. Bid Your not play - MNT zero gain.
Win 50 roubles
Win 100 roubles
Win 500 roubles
Win 1,000 roubles
Win 1,500 roubles
Win 2,000 roubles
Win 2,500 roubles
Win 5,000 roubles
Win 10,000 roubles
Win 20,000 roubles
Win 30,000 roubles
Win 40,000 roubles
Win 50,000 roubles
Jackpot! You win 100,000 roubles
Labeled here you asked about dolzhka...\nYou would have looked, and gave - a penny remained the same.
Aya-ay I'm tagging, then the term has passed, and you do not bring a payback in a hurry. Let's hurry up.
And what does it mean Spot? You have given time?\nDali. The term came out - Dui here with money.
So, so tagging, so we love to play, but give no debts.\nIt is not good. Even vice-versa - it is bad. Hands for this tear is necessary. Understood?
Labelled you even brazen. What the hell are you I ask you carry no debt?\nThen the guys came and promised to cut you to the British flag, and what's left - the flesh to feed. Come see me alive.
I do not understand human. We like dogovarilivalis?\nDuty for three days - and no, "but I could not, I'm sorry".\nDo what you want, but the debt is returned immediately. Otherwise - you kranty.
Come quickly labeled on the base "Pure Heaven" by Syslov.\nYou expect' ... On the bubble. Otherwise, blame yourself - ax is sharpened.
Well, you and Spot pig - you're a bitch I expose that money do not give.\nIf the evening did not bring back the debt - the entrance to the base you will be closed forever.
Last warning Chinese Spot:\nall the time went, and you even lifted a finger!\nYes, you will enscribe, if you loot will not come back.
Tagged - you're dead.
netpacket PDA
Please keep your hands off this device!
Bolt's PDA
Bolt's PDA. Contents require careful study
Scientist's flash drive
